instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3302: What is 820-3302? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3302</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Wont start
threads.message: Got an <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3302</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> today - won't start up - there is one green diagnostic led - when I press the power button the fan spins a little then stops - no activity on any other diagnostic led's that I can see. Nothing immediately visible i'm wondering if this points to a PSU issue?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3302</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Wont start
threads.message:
<TRANSISTOR>Q7950</TRANSISTOR> fails a lot there.
Change it, just for test...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3302</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Wont start
threads.message: I can try that but I cannot find IRF6892 from a reputable supplier - is there an alternative available?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3302</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Wont start
threads.message: Actually I don't think it's <TRANSISTOR>Q7950</TRANSISTOR> - I did try the SMC bypass mode and got the fan spinning on full and the voltage output of <TRANSISTOR>Q7950</TRANSISTOR> was 12.2v on <SIGNAL>PP12V_S0</SIGNAL> - that should indicate <TRANSISTOR>Q7950</TRANSISTOR> is working?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3302</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Wont start
threads.message:
Looks like <TRANSISTOR>Q7950</TRANSISTOR> is good, if you get steady <SIGNAL>12V_S0</SIGNAL>.
Just to confirm, do you get 22V at its Gate pin?

In SMC bypass, do you have USB activity?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3302</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Wont start
threads.message: there is no USB activity in SMC Bypass mode = also no display and no more diagnostic LED's light up. I'm getting 15v on the gate pin of <TRANSISTOR>Q7950</TRANSISTOR> (tested at <CHIP>U7950</CHIP>) and yes there is stable <SIGNAL>PP12V_S0</SIGNAL> in smc bypass mode.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3302</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Wont start
threads.message:
I recommend to change <TRANSISTOR>Q7950</TRANSISTOR>, or at least <CHIP>U7950</CHIP>; +3V is not a good value for Vgs...

If board only turns on in SMC bypass mode, check the sensors output from page 48.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3302</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Wont start
threads.message: Gave up with this and got the customer another motherboard for $150.
